org.fishwife.jrugged

Interface Initializable


  • public interface Initializable
    Clients who use the Initializer should implement this interface. This lets them do, for example: 
        new Initializer(this).initialize();
    and the Initializer will take care of retrying an initialization. This pattern is good for subsystems that need to talk to something that is currently down at startup time. For example, if your database is down when your app server starts up, this can let your app server keep trying to connect without getting wedged or needing to restart.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void afterInit()
      Called by the initializer after background initialization succeeds.
      void configuredRetriesMetOrExceededWithoutSuccess()
      In the event that I have attempted to initialize, but I fail having exceeded my max number of retries to succeed, I will get a callback into this method indicating I have met or Exceeded my attempts to start
      void tryInit()
      Makes an initialization attempt.

    • Method Detail

      • tryInit

        void tryInit()
      throws Exception
        Makes an initialization attempt. If an exception is thrown, assume attempt failed.
        Throws:
        Exception - if the attempt to init fails due to wrapped item throwing

      • afterInit

        void afterInit()
        Called by the initializer after background initialization succeeds. Can be used to mark the client as "ready to serve" or "active", etc.

      • configuredRetriesMetOrExceededWithoutSuccess

        void configuredRetriesMetOrExceededWithoutSuccess()
        In the event that I have attempted to initialize, but I fail having exceeded my max number of retries to succeed, I will get a callback into this method indicating I have met or Exceeded my attempts to start
